intro: Hieracium nyctopum, commonly known as the night hawk's eye, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium nyctopum is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates.
